com.adobe.aem.init.dogmatix.http.handlers.modules.resources.storage

Interface Repository

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FTPRepository, LocalRepository, RemoteRepository, S3Repository

    public interface Repository
    Interface for a file repository. Supported operations are to be implemented by concrete classes which actually represent real-world repositories.
    Author:
    vnagpal
    See Also:
    LocalRepository, S3Repository, RemoteRepository, FTPRepository

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void create(FileUpload fileUpload)
      Creates a new file in the repository
      void delete(String uri)
      Deletes the specified file from the repo permanently.
      boolean exists(String uri)
      Checks for the existence of the specified file path Consumers should check for existence before any operation to avoid exceptions.
      Metadata getInfo(String uri)
      Queries the repository for file info metadata.
      FileInputStream lookin(String parentPath, String fileName)
      Convenience method to lookup a file within a folder.
      FileInputStream lookup(String filePath)
      Gets the request file handle as an input stream.

    • Method Detail

      • lookup

        FileInputStream lookup(String filePath)
                       throws IOException
        Gets the request file handle as an input stream. The caller method bears the responsibility of retrying the lookup in case of connection failure
        Parameters:
        filePath - requested file path
        Returns:
        the file as input stream
        Throws:
        IOException - if not able to connect to the repo or if file not found

      • lookin

        FileInputStream lookin(String parentPath,
                     String fileName)
                       throws IOException
        Convenience method to lookup a file within a folder. Gets the request file handle as an input stream. The caller method bears the responsibility of retrying the lookup in case of connection failure
        Parameters:
        parentPath - path of the folder to look in
        fileName - requested file
        Returns:
        the file as input stream
        Throws:
        IOException - if not able to connect to the repo or if file not found

      • create

        void create(FileUpload fileUpload)
            throws IOException
        Creates a new file in the repository
        Parameters:
        fileUpload - the file contents as an in-memory
        Throws:
        IOException - if file already exists or if not able to connect to the repo

      • exists

        boolean exists(String uri)
               throws IOException
        Checks for the existence of the specified file path Consumers should check for existence before any operation to avoid exceptions.
        Parameters:
        uri - path to lookup
        Returns:
        true if a file exists at the specified location, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException - if not able to connect to the repo

      • delete

        void delete(String uri)
            throws IOException
        Deletes the specified file from the repo permanently. This action is irreversible and this method should be used with care and awareness especially when working with remote repos. If some repo extends the functionality of a soft delete and rescue, it must be implemented separately in the child class. Such methods, since not standard across all types of file storage, are not part of the top most ancestor in the class heirarchy
        Parameters:
        uri - the path to delete
        Throws:
        IOException - if file does not exist at desired location or if not able to connect to the repo

      • getInfo

        Metadata getInfo(String uri)
                 throws IOException
        Queries the repository for file info metadata.
        Parameters:
        uri - the path to get info for
        Returns:
        a wrapper over file info metadata
        Throws:
        IOException - if file does not exist at desired location or if not able to connect to the repo
